intro: Irenepharsus, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Campanulaceae. These plants are characterized by their bell-shaped flowers, which are typically yellow or golden in color. They are native to regions in Europe, Asia, and North Africa, often growing in woodland or grassland habitats. Irenepharsus species are herbaceous perennials that produce showy inflorescences during the summer months. Their ornamental value makes them popular in gardens and floral arrangements.
